FuncDef:
The multicast-nat instance command creates a multicast NAT instance and displays the multicast NAT instance view.
The undo multicast-nat instance command deletes a multicast NAT instance.
By default, no multicast NAT instance is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a multicast NAT instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the ID of a multicast NAT instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16000.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In multicast NAT, to translate an input multicast stream into output multicast streams, you must create a multicast NAT instance. To simplify the multicast NAT configuration, run the multicast-nat instance command to create a multicast NAT instance so that input multicast streams can be associated with the multicast NAT instance.
Prerequisites
Multicast NAT has been globally enabled using the multicast-nat enable command.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the multicast-nat bind command in the traffic behavior view to bind the multicast NAT instance to the traffic behavior.
Apply the traffic policy on the inbound interface of multicast streams, so that input multicast streams are associated with the multicast NAT instance.
Precautions
This command is supported only in the admin VS.
